index.md: Boost helpdesk efficiency with Open Ticket AI, the secure, open-source, on-premise solution for automating support ticket classification.
blog\\ai-in-open-source-ticketsystems.md: Bridge the intelligence gap in open-source help desks like osTicket & Zammad. This guide shows how to use AI to automate ticket classification and workflows.
blog\\ai-in-ticketsystems.md: Discover how AI transforms ticket management. Automate ticket prioritization, categorization, and routing to streamline support workflows and boost satisfaction.
blog\\ai_classifiers_metrics.md: Learn to evaluate AI ticket classifiers on real, imbalanced data. Discover why accuracy is misleading and focus on metrics that matter: precision, recall & F1-score.
blog\\automatic_ticket_labeling.md: Save time labeling thousands of tickets. Learn a semi-automated workflow using GPT for zero-shot pre-labeling and Label Studio for efficient review.
blog\\fine-tuning-an-ai-model-with-own-t: Fine-tune an AI model on your ticket data for accurate, automated classification. This guide shows how to prepare datasets and train with Hugging Face or a REST API.
blog\\integrating-freshdesk-open-ticket-: Integrate on-premise Open Ticket AI with Freshdesk for automated ticket classification. Learn to create a custom Python adapter to update tickets via the REST API.
Learn to integrate OpenTicketAI with Zammad for on-premise AI ticket classification. Use the REST API to fetch, classify, and update ticket queues & priorities.
blog\\integrating-zendesk-open-ticket-ai: Integrate Zendesk with Open Ticket AI for automated ticket classification. Build a custom Python adapter to auto-triage tickets by priority via REST API.
developers\\architecture.md: Learn about the Open Ticket AI architecture. Discover how its modular data pipeline and Hugging Face models power intelligent ticket classification and routing.
developers\\developer-information.md: Dev guide for the on-premise ATC ticket classifier. Learn to configure with YAML, run from the CLI, and extend with custom Python components & adapters.
guide\\otobo-znuny-otrs-integration.md: Integrate Python with OTOBO, Znuny, & OTRS using an async client library. This guide provides code examples for managing helpdesk tickets via REST API.
guide\\plan-ticket-automation-project.md: Plan your ticket automation project. Choose the right path based on your data—labeled, unlabeled, or none—for fast training, deployment, and support.
products\\overview.md: Discover Open Ticket AI's suite: an on-prem classifier, hosted API, synthetic data generator, and public models to automate your support ticket workflow.
products\\prediction-api\\overview.md: Free German API to predict Queue and Priority for support tickets. Easy integration with OTOBO, Znuny, and Zammad. No authentication required.
products\\synthetic-data\\synthetic-data: Generate multilingual synthetic customer-support ticket datasets with our Python tool. Features a graph pipeline, AI assistants, rich fields & cost tracking.
products\\synthetic-data\\ticket-dataset: Train queue, priority & type models with our synthetic multilingual customer support tickets. Includes rich fields & multiple versions. Available on Kaggle.
developers\\api\\config.md: Configure Open Ticket AI's core services. Learn to set up the OTOBO adapter, data preparers, and a local Hugging Face AI for automated ticket processing.
developers\\api\\dependency_injection.md: Explore the Core module's Dependency Injection API. This official documentation provides a complete reference for all available classes and functions.
developers\\api\\experimental.md: Access the Open Ticket AI Experimental API. Explore cutting-edge features and advanced functions still in development and help shape our platform's future.
developers\\api\\mixins.md: Learn about the Providable base class, a core Python mixin for creating registry-managed objects with built-in configuration and key generation.
developers\\api\\util.md: Docs for OpenTicketAI's core utilities. Learn to generate a `config.schema.json` for config validation, autocompletion, and managing project settings.
